trans-unit.source: Monitor jobs on Stream Analytics programmatically | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Monitor jobs on Stream Analytics programmatically | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to programmatically monitor Stream Analytics jobs created via REST APIs, Azure SDK, or Powershell.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to programmatically monitor Stream Analytics jobs created via REST APIs, Azure SDK, or Powershell.

trans-unit.source: Programmatically monitor Stream Analytics jobs
trans-unit.target: Programmatically monitor Stream Analytics jobs

trans-unit.source: This article demonstrates how to enable monitoring for a Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: This article demonstrates how to enable monitoring for a Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics jobs created via REST APIs, Azure SDK, or Powershell do not have monitoring enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics jobs created via REST APIs, Azure SDK, or Powershell do not have monitoring enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: You can manually enable this in the Azure Portal by navigating to the job’s Monitor page and clicking the Enable button or you can automate this process by following the steps in this article.
trans-unit.target: You can manually enable this in the Azure Portal by navigating to the job’s Monitor page and clicking the Enable button or you can automate this process by following the steps in this article.

trans-unit.source: The monitoring data will show up in the “Monitor” tab in the Azure Portal for your Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: The monitoring data will show up in the “Monitor” tab in the Azure Portal for your Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Monitor Jobs Tab</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Monitor Jobs Tab</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013.

trans-unit.source: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Download and install <link><linkText>Azure .NET SDK</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: An existing Stream Analytics job that needs monitoring enabled.
trans-unit.target: An existing Stream Analytics job that needs monitoring enabled.

trans-unit.source: Setup a project
trans-unit.target: Setup a project

trans-unit.source: Create a Visual Studio C# .Net console application.
trans-unit.target: Create a Visual Studio C# .Net console application.

trans-unit.source: In the Package Manager Console, run the following commands to install the NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: In the Package Manager Console, run the following commands to install the NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: The first one is the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.
trans-unit.target: The first one is the Azure Stream Analytics Management .NET SDK.

trans-unit.source: The second one is the Azure Insights SDK which will be used to enable monitoring.
trans-unit.target: The second one is the Azure Insights SDK which will be used to enable monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The last one is the Azure Active Directory client that will be used for authentication.
trans-unit.target: The last one is the Azure Active Directory client that will be used for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Add the following appSettings section to the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: Add the following appSettings section to the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Replace values for SubscriptionId and ActiveDirectoryTenantId with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.
trans-unit.target: Replace values for SubscriptionId and ActiveDirectoryTenantId with your Azure subscription and tenant IDs.

trans-unit.source: You can get these values by running the following PowerShell cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: You can get these values by running the following PowerShell cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project.
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to the source file (Program.cs) in the project.

trans-unit.source: Add an authentication helper method.
trans-unit.target: Add an authentication helper method.

trans-unit.source: Create Management Clients
trans-unit.target: Create Management Clients

trans-unit.source: The following code will set up the necessary variables and management clients.
trans-unit.target: The following code will set up the necessary variables and management clients.

trans-unit.source: Enable Monitoring For an Existing Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Enable Monitoring For an Existing Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: The following code will enable monitoring for an existing Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: The following code will enable monitoring for an existing Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: The first part of the code performs a GET request against the Stream Analytics service to retrieve information about the particular Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: The first part of the code performs a GET request against the Stream Analytics service to retrieve information about the particular Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: It uses the “Id” property (retrieved from the GET request) as a parameter for the Put method in the second half of the code which sends a PUT request to the Insights service to enable monitoring for the Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: It uses the “Id” property (retrieved from the GET request) as a parameter for the Put method in the second half of the code which sends a PUT request to the Insights service to enable monitoring for the Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: If you have previously enabled monitoring for a different Stream Analytics job, either through the Azure Portal or programmatically via the below code, it is recommended that you provide the same storage account name that you did when you previously enabled monitoring.
trans-unit.target: If you have previously enabled monitoring for a different Stream Analytics job, either through the Azure Portal or programmatically via the below code, it is recommended that you provide the same storage account name that you did when you previously enabled monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The storage account is linked to the region you created your Stream Analytics job in, not specifically to the job itself.
trans-unit.target: The storage account is linked to the region you created your Stream Analytics job in, not specifically to the job itself.

trans-unit.source: All Stream Analytics job (and all other Azure resources) in that same region share this storage account to store monitoring data.
trans-unit.target: All Stream Analytics job (and all other Azure resources) in that same region share this storage account to store monitoring data.

trans-unit.source: If you provide a different storage account, it may cause unintended side effects to the monitoring of your other Stream Analytics jobs and/or other Azure resources.
trans-unit.target: If you provide a different storage account, it may cause unintended side effects to the monitoring of your other Stream Analytics jobs and/or other Azure resources.

trans-unit.source: The storage account name used to replace “” below should be a storage account that is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job you are enabling monitoring for.
trans-unit.target: The storage account name used to replace “” below should be a storage account that is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job you are enabling monitoring for.
